questiontext.text:
Find the Jacobian for the following transformation:
\(x={@xexp@}\),
\(y={@xexp@}\),
\(z={@xexp@}\)

\(|J|=\,\)[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Evaluating the partial derivatives,
\(\qquad \dfrac{\partial x}{\partial u}= {@dxdu@}\), \(\qquad\dfrac{\partial x}{\partial v}= {@dxdv@}\), \(\qquad\dfrac{\partial x}{\partial w}= {@dxdw@}\),
\(\qquad \dfrac{\partial y}{\partial u}= {@dydu@}\), \(\qquad\dfrac{\partial y}{\partial v}= {@dydv@}\), \(\qquad\dfrac{\partial y}{\partial w}= {@dydw@}\),
\(\qquad \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial u}= {@dzdu@}\), \(\qquad \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial v}= {@dzdv@}\), \(\qquad \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial w}= {@dzdw@}\)
so the Jacobian is \[\left| \begin{array}{ccc} \dfrac{\partial x}{\partial u} & \dfrac{\partial x}{\partial v} & \dfrac{\partial x}{\partial w} \\ \\ \dfrac{\partial y}{\partial u} & \dfrac{\partial y}{\partial v} & \dfrac{\partial y}{\partial w} \\ \\ \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial u} & \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial v} & \dfrac{\partial z}{\partial w} \end{array} \right| = \left| \begin{array}{ccc} {@dxdu@} & {@dxdv@} & {@dxdw@} \\ \\ {@dydu@} & {@dydv@} & {@dydw@} \\ \\ {@dzdu@} & {@dzdv@} & {@dzdw@} \end{array}\right| = {@ta1@} \] where expansion of the determinant has taken place down the first column.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
